Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that there were actually 52 positive COVID-19 tests among children aged under 1 year, not 85 as stated.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the number of positive COVID-19 tests among children aged under 1 year in Nueces County.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement in the claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters by misrepresenting the true figure of positive tests among children under 2 years old.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide any evidence or sources to back up the number of positive tests.
Problematic assumption: There is no evidence of a problematic assumption in the claim.
Exist alternative explanation: The alternative explanation is that the Nueces County Public Health Director inadvertently misinterpreted the data, leading to the misrepresentation of the true figure.
